MOD: Fegelein
BACKUP MOD: JacobSavage


In a distant and relatively sparse town somewhere on the East Coast of America, trouble was brewing. Mayor Fegelein had made his most controversial decision yet. The eccentric and paranoid man was worried that with the recent declaration of war on Russia that Russian spies would infiltrate his Town. After a mass stockpile on food, drink and supplies, Mayor Fegelein locked down the Town, denying anybody entry or access to either enter or leave the Town. To many, this may have ruined their lives by denying them the right to visit friends and family, but on the bright side, at least it would protect them from the Russians, right?

Yes.

But not from the Mafia.

This new act prevented the Mafia from being able to trade with their associates. Trapped in the town like everybody else, the Mafia decided to create an insurgency to unlock the Town. But the only way that was going to happen was with everybody else dead. Starting with Mayor Fegelein.

*fade to black*

"BANGBANGBANGBANGBANG!". A ferocious volley of bullets could be heard roaring through the Town at 2am in the morning. Everybody in the Town was quick to crowd in the Town square as the carcass of Mayor Fegelein, wrapped in a bodybag was quickly dumped into a coffin and taken to the cemetery to be disposed of. During the early hours, a meeting was called with the townsfolk, and in an incredible 13-0 landslide victory, it was decided that the Townspeople would execute one person per day in order to catch the people responsible for this atrocity. The hunt was on to stop the Insurgent force.


Fegelein, Town Mayor, was killed Night 0.

RULES:
ONE: FUNDAMENTALS
I) All site-wide rules apply. Read and respect them.
II) There is no personal communication outside the forum postings (regarding this game) unless your role specifically allows it.
III) Do not quote your Role PM or any private communication (either real or fabricated) with the moderator, co-moderator, backup-moderator, or fellow players. Paraphrasing your Role PM is acceptable.
IV) Be courteous and respectful to all your fellow players and the moderating team.
V) Play to your Win Condition.

TWO: DAY PHASE (DP)
I) Each DP shall have a two week deadline.
II) Votes must be bolded or they shall not be counted. This includes the word "Vote", along with the players name. Abbreviating someone's name is acceptable, so long as I can discern who you were voting for without trouble.
III) Unvoting is encouraged, but not required.
IV) Once you have reached a simple majority (half of all living players plus one) that person's fate is sealed and they shall be lynched. Unvoting cannot change their fate.
V)If a simple majority (half of all living players plus one) approve a No Lynch (Vote: No Lynch), then no player shall be lynched and the game shall enter Night Phase. If deadline is reached and no one has received a simple majority of the votes, no one shall be lynched.
VI) Once a player is lynched the game enters twilight until I arrive and post a death scene. All players may continue to post during Twilight.
VII) Prods: If you have failed to post for over 48 hours, (weekends will count as half time. i.e. if you post on Friday I won't prod you til Tuesday) I will send you a prod. Failure to respond to this prod within 48 hours will result in the replacement of that player.
Force-replacing of flakers/rule-breakers will be occur at my discretion.
VIII) If half of the living players post "@Mod: Requesting Deadline Extension", the request will be granted. The amount of time will vary at the mods disgression. This rule may only be used once per game. Other extensions, if any, will occur at my discretion.
IX) Votes and Unvotes shall not count in Twilight.

THREE: NIGHT PHASE (NP)
I) NP shall last 72 hours.
II) Any role or faction with night abilities may choose to use them by PM-ing the mod with their choice.
III) If no action is received, no action will be taken. All actions received after the deadline has passed will not be valid.
IV) If multiple actions are received, the last one received will be valid.
V) Night Action submissions will be accepted starting in the Twilight Phase.

FOUR: CAPITAL OFFENSES
I) Do not quote your Role PM or any private communication (either real or fabricated) with the moderator, co-moderator, or backup-moderator. Paraphrasing your Role PM is acceptable.
II) There is to be no personal communication outside the forum postings (regarding this game) unless your role specifically allows it.
III) I will use the color BLUE for mod stuff outside of my posts. Posts originally made by me will vary in color.
IV) Do not attempt to analyze the mechanics of a role PM in comparison to other players. For example, "the fourth word of my role PM is town." Or "my PM was sent at 11:23, when was yours?"
V) At no time should there be pre-game alliances made.
VI) You are expected to be an active participant in this game. Do not flake.
VII) Do not discuss ongoing games in the game.
VIII) Do not discuss the game or post in the thread when you are dead outside of the Dead QT.
IX) The following is a list of outlawed shenanigans:

Using invisible text, codes, cryptography, etc.
Editing your posts
Screenshotting your Role PM
Insulting other players
Quoting any QTs you may have access to (paraphrasing is acceptable)
Posting in-thread after you have died

If any of these offenses are committed, I have the right to force-replace you from the game or modkill you. A warning will usually come before replacement or modkilling, depending on the severity of the infraction.

FIVE: MISCELLANEOUS
I) Feel free to address me in-thread, but if there is a large egregious mistake please PM me. Small matters like errors in the votecount can be posted in-thread.
II) I have the final say on any issue. I reserve the right to force-replace and modkill at my will.
III) This is a game. Have fun, and keep the game fun for other people. Stay civilized, please.
IV) I have the right to edit this RuleSet at any time, alerting you when I do.
V) Any groups with quick topics may use them as indicated in their role PM. Please note that all QTs will be released at game end, so please leave out anything you don't want made public.
VI) Scum or any other players with a quicktopic do indeed have daychat.

Additionally, while I agree that he is defending ABR, he refuses to claim that ABR is a townread, using such cop-outs as "isn't necessarily a bad post." When he says that ABR's post "isn't necessarily a bad post," we get two possibilities - either ABR is a nullread, in which case this post from aphix is doing exactly what I said it was doing (talking a whole lot about someone without taking a stance, which is scummy - townies are typically concerned with people that they have reads on, or with forming reads on those who they don't have reads on). Or, ABR is a townread, in which case, why not out-and-out say that ABR is a townread instead of using that phrasing?

In essence, he is showing that he doesn't believe ABR to be scummy for the reasons provided... yet. He doesn't preclude the possibility that what ABR has done *IS* scummy by saying that it's "not necessarily" scummy, and he fails to take any stance on ABR himself, nor does he take a stance on anyone else.

Him giving implicit defense of ABR is scummy on its own, in my opinion. I find explicitness to be a towntell and implicitness to be a scumtell - townies are more willing to simply speak their minds, whereas scum want to leave their options open. His giving a null read on EPM is also scummy after he's been talking about EPM.

Wishy-washy does not mean contradictory; it means "lacking in decisiveness; without strength or character; irresolute."

You may consider those votes "distracting." I don't, because I consider attention towards aphix a good thing.

I consider wishy-washiness a scumtell more so than a VI tell, because it is, in my experience. In my experience, it's one of the better commonly-cited tells.

Note that when I say wishy-washiness is a scumtell I don't mean that having null reads is bad; I mean that making it look like you're actively contributing without actually taking meaningful stances on things is scummy, because scum like to look like they're contributing but often don't like to lock themselves in to positions.

Can you stop with the buzzwords? Or if you want to hide behind buzzwords, can you at least use them correctly?

Let's break down the massive amount of stuff wrong here.
1) Putting words in quotations is a logical fallacy in itself. It's an appeal to motive. You are trying to get people to question my motives merely by presenting them as questionable. You've brought forth no corresponding evidence to back up your charge that I'm not actually frustrated.
2) Appeal to emotion is a broad category of logical fallacies. And they are fallacies because they are attempting to sway people by inducing an emotional response in the listener. By reading my rant, did I intimidate you into agreeing with me? Did I make you pity me? Even if you can't pin-point the exact emotion I'm attempting to play on, can you at least show a logical endpoint to my accused manipulation?
3) By listing me as being emotional, you are conducting an ad hominem fallacy (specifically poisoning the well). You are attacking character instead of argument. In fact you haven't addressed the actual argument at any time, you've just characterized it as emotional (actually, going an additional step and falsely claiming it's fallacious) and therefore not worthy of consideration.
4) You're also committing a hasty generalization fallacy. Mafia is a game of individuals. Individuals do not automatically become more logical when they get a town role and conversely scum do not become less logical. I get the general idea that scum have to twist logic to make innocent players look guilty, but over-zealous town players commit the same logical fallacies all the time over and over. Seeing a player commit a logical fallacy is not a scumtell, please stop describing it as such. I'll grant that it's not a towntell. But lack of good does not mean bad (aka affirming the consequent fallacy)
5) Not the mention the constant tunneling you're doing. Or, more formally, assuming the conclusion. Anything can be used as evidence that someone is scum if you already believe that they are scum.

So stop with your whole "logical fallacy = scum" rationalizing. Everyone commits multiple logical fallacies constantly. So if you are town, then you're never going to be accurately scum-hunting as you are only targeting the player and not the role. Scum will love you because they can easily manipulate you.

Despite all the fallacies you've committed, I'm starting to come around that you might be town. Just bad town with an anti-town (overly verbose) posting style. You need to stop attacking semantics and start answering the heart of what's being asked of you.
